name: Broccoli Pasta
ingredients: Optional: lemon, chicken or rotisserie chicken
instructions: Boil water and salt it. Cook broccoli until fork tender, 4–6 min. In a separate pan, heat oil, then add garlic and chili flakes off heat. Mash cooked broccoli into garlic oil. Cook pasta al dente, reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain. Add pasta, cheese, and some water to broccoli mix; stir until creamy. Add more water if needed. Season and serve. Leftovers last 3 days refrigerated.

name: Black Bean Quesadillas
ingredients: Optional: salsa, sour cream, chicken, guac or avocado
instructions: Heat and season beans, optionally mash. Spread on tortilla, top with cheese, fold, and heat. Serve with desired toppings like sour cream or hot sauce.

name: Vodka Tortellini
instructions: Cook tortellini. Heat vodka sauce with chicken and/or veggies. Combine and serve.

name: Broccoli Noodles and Cheese Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Cook noodles until al dente. Steam broccoli until tender. Mix pasta, broccoli, and cottage cheese in baking dish. Sprinkle with cheddar and bake 8–10 minutes until bubbly.

name: Eggy Ramen Noodles
ingredients: Optional: green onions, tofu, sprouts, etc.
instructions: Cook ramen, keep a bit of broth. Mix egg with sriracha and mayo in a bowl. Slowly drizzle hot broth into egg mix to temper. Add noodles and toppings.

name: Greek Inspired Salad
instructions: Chop and mix all ingredients. Optionally top with chicken. Serve cold.

name: Shrimp Tacos
instructions: Cook and season shrimp. Assemble tacos with shrimp, cabbage, lime, and sauce.

name: Chicken Curry Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
instructions: Microwave or bake sweet potatoes until soft. Split open and fluff. Top with curry sauce, cauliflower, chicken, and cilantro. Serve warm.

name: Chili-Rubbed Tilapia with Asparagus & Lemon
instructions: Steam asparagus. Mix spices and coat fish. Pan-sear fish until opaque. Add lemon juice and asparagus to pan to coat and heat. Serve with fish.

name: Spicy Chicken Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: 1 head of butter lettuce, leaves separated
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened (approximately 10 minutes). Add ground chicken and cook until no traces of pink remain (about 7–10 minutes). Stir in soy sauce, hoisin sauce, sriracha sauce, and ground ginger. Cook for 5 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly, stirring occasionally. Stir in chopped peanuts. Spoon chicken mixture onto lettuce leaves. Garnish with cilantro and lime wedges. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.
